name: Byte
headline: On-demand food delivery from dark kitchens in Pakistan.

founders.name: Safee Shah, Founder/CEO
founders.description:
Former General Manager Pakistan, Uber.
Exec Ed, Harvard Business School Online.
MBA, Emory University.
Fulbright Scholar.

generated_description:
**Byte: Your On-Demand Food Delivery Solution in Pakistan**

Founded in 2021 and part of the Y Combinator Batch S20, Byte is revolutionizing the food delivery landscape in Pakistan. Based in Lahore, this innovative company is focused on providing on-demand food delivery from dark kitchensâ€”restaurants without a physical storefront, designed exclusively for delivery. 

What's noteworthy about Byte is not just its focus on convenience, but also its strategic model that harnesses the efficiency of ghost kitchens. These setups allow for a diverse range of cuisines without the overhead costs of a traditional restaurant, thereby opening up opportunities for both consumers and chefs.

With a lean team of 30 employees, Byte is agile and ready to adapt to the growing demands of the marketplace. Their website, still in its nascent stages, aims to be a seamless hub for food lovers looking for their next meal.

Taglined with keywords like 'ghost-kitchens', 'marketplace', and 'delivery', Byte is not just participating in the food delivery space; it's actively reshaping how people think about dining options in urban Pakistan. 

While specific activities are still being defined, Byte's commitment to efficiency, quality, and customer service is clear. As dark kitchens gain traction, Byte is positioned to be a key player in this evolving industry. You can explore more about their offerings and journey at [Byte's website](https://web.thebyte.app/en/). 

In summary, Byte isn't just about food delivery; it's about rethinking how food can be made, accessed, and enjoyed in the digital age.
